column4: if I boot windows xp, start partition magic and choose to expand the partition which ubuntu is installed in - everything should go fine, right?
wooow... too much linux-talk for a newbie like me
but partition magic is capable of creating/resizing ext3-partitions
would ubuntu recognize the extra space?
yes thats what i used to install ubuntu
what are you trying to do?
increase my ext3-partition with ubuntu installed on it
you can safely resize it without it messing up linux.  Do a backup if you dont want to take any chances
